intro: Parapimpinella, commonly known as yellow bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are annual or biennial herbs native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have hairy stems and alternate leaves that are often lobed or divided. Their flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and they produce small, elongated pods containing several seeds. Parapimpinella species are often found in disturbed soils and are adapted to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
